Best of 2017

31 Dec 2017 tagged in

A summary of books, films, TV, performances, and other things produced, consumed and enjoyed this year by me:

Best Non-Fiction Read for the First Time

  • A World Not to Come: A History of Latino Writing and Print Culture by Raul Coronado
  • Bad Feminist by Roxane Gay
  • Hunger: A Memoir of (My) Body by Roxane Gay
  • Ruin Nation: Destruction and the American Civil War by Megan Kate Nelson

Best Fiction/Poetry Read for the First Time:

  • Homegoing by Yaa Gyasi
  • Little Fires Everywhere by Celeste Ng
  • Make Your Home Among Strangers by Jennine Capó Crucet
  • Walkaway by Cory Doctorow

Best TV Watched for the First Time: 

  • Battlestar Galactica (2004-2009)
  • BoJack Horseman (2014-)
  • Dear White People (2017-)
  • GLOW (2017-)
  • The Gay and Wondrous Life of Caleb Gallo (2016)
  • Veep (2012-)

Best Movies Watched for the First Time:

  • Chicago (2002)
  • Sing Street (2016)
  • Tallulah (2016)
  • World of Tomorrow Episode 2: The Burden of Other People’s Thoughts (2017)

Best Performances:

  • In The Heights @ Brown University Stuart Theatre (Sock & Buskin)
  • Les Miserables @ Providence Performing Arts Center
  • Fun Home @ Providence Performing Arts Center
  • JFK100 @ The Kennedy Center

(Some of the best) Posts/Articles/Podcasts/Talks By Other People Published This Year:

  • Digital Is More Than a Department, It Is a Collective Responsibility by Loic Tallon (Mediu)
  • I am not a Social Media Guru by W. Ryan Dodge (Medium)
  • At World’s End by Reply All (Gimlet Media)
  • The Choreography of Things by Sydney Skybetter (Brown University)
  • What wearing the “green and grey” means in 21st-century America by Leah Burgin (John Nichols Brown Center for Public Humanities and Cultural Heritage)
  • Why Does Canada150 Give Canadian Historians a Headache? By Andrea Eidinger (Unwritten Histories)
  • At the Metropolitan Museum by Matthew Siegel (poem-a-day)

Best Pieces Written by Me: 

  • Digital Storytelling: It’s Britney Bitch: Commentary on Distortion in Spears’s Use of Social Media
  • HASTAC: Collaborative Review of Structuring Equality, Chapter 3: The Atlanta Compromise, Reacting to the Past
  • Medium: Catalog as Book, File, and Database: Cataloging History, Part 3
  • SCLDA: Documenting the Use of the Smithsonian Learning Lab Among Smithsonian Museums, Research Centers, and Programmatic Offices
  • Stars Hollow Historical Society: The Founding of Stars Hollow: Glassberg on Gilmore Girls (Part One)
  • The Artifice: The Degrassi Franchise on the Teenage Experience
  • Website (Personal): What I Learned During My Summer Practicum: On Escape, Reevaluation, and Being a Public Human
